name: REGENT
headline: All-electric seagliders for fast, affordable regional transportation
description:
REGENT is building a new mode of transportation that will redefine regional mobility by mid-decade. Their first product, the seaglider, is an all-electric, hydrofoiling boat-plane that operates within a wingspan of the water's surface.  By flying low on a cushion of air, seagliders unlock the ability to fly twice as far as an electric aircraft, while being regulated by maritime authorities enabling market entry for a fraction of the cost.

REGENT has de-risked seaglider technology with a ¼-scale, 400 lb, flying demonstration vehicle and a full-scale wing test section. By 2024, REGENT will fly humans on the first full-scale prototype seaglider.  By mid-decade, REGENT’s customers - airlines and ferry companies – will begin commercial seaglider service on the 12-seat initial product.

In just two years, REGENT has accumulated $8B in provisional orders (including firm deposits) proving the potential of the $25B+ initial market. 

REGENT, a team of 40, is led by MIT-trained, ex-Boeing engineers Billy Thalheimer and Mike Klinker.  REGENT has raised $50M to date from the likes of Thiel Capital, Founders Fund, Mark Cuban, Y Combinator, and includes strategic investment from Japan Airlines, Hawaiian Airlines and Mesa Airlines.

founders.name: Billy Thalheimer, Founder
founders.description:
Billy is an aerospace business leader and multidisciplinary engineer with expertise spanning aviation entrepreneurship and novel aircraft development. 

At Aurora Flight Sciences, Billy led execution and BD for next-gen aircraft programs. Holding a BS/MS from MIT in aerospace engineering, he also led flight physics modeling for Boeing's electric air taxi, and authored their custom aircraft design code.

As a passionate aerospace nerd, Billy spends his free time competing as an aerobatic pilot.

founders.name: Michael Klinker, Founder
founders.description: Aviation runs in Mike’s blood--he received his Bachelors and Masters degrees from MIT focused on aircraft controls and autonomy, is an avid pilot, and loves any vehicle that flies or floats. Mike spent years at Airware, Raptor Maps, MIT Lincoln Labs, and Aurora Flight Sciences designing and operating innovative vehicles.  Mike has built and written control software for over a dozen aircraft, and brings his advanced flight controls and abundant flight test experience to REGENT as its CTO.

raw_markdown='[CNBC: Thiel Capital and regional airline Mesa invest in electric seaglider start-up REGENT](http://regentcraft.com/<https:/www.cnbc.com/2022/02/04/thiel-capital-mesa-air-invest-in-electric-seaglider-startup-regent.html>)
[![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/664e67855164bd364afa2f89_REGENT-RGB-FullLogo-ColorLight.svg)](http://regentcraft.com/</>)[Company](http://regentcraft.com/</company>)[Seagliders](http://regentcraft.com/</seagliders/viceroy>)[Careers](http://regentcraft.com/</careers>)[Newsroom](http://regentcraft.com/</newsroom>)[Contact](http://regentcraft.com/</contact>)
# Coastal Travel. 100% Electric.
[Watch our Path to Human Flight](http://regentcraft.com/</video>)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/6750eb7a6e4935b2312e0a1d_REGENT_Viceroy_Front.avif)
Introducing
## Seaglider
We develop & manufacture all-electric, passenger-carrying, wing-in-ground-effect vehicles to service coastal routes, building on real-world-proven tech.
[Learn More](http://regentcraft.com/</seagliders/viceroy>)
![Electric Icon](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/60301a8206897d359d25b542_Renewable%20Energy%20Electricity%20Recycle%20Blue.svg)
### Zero-emission, ultra-low-altitude travel
![Distance Icon](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/60301a82ffca11bf80f751bf_Map%20Location%20Pin%20Geolocation%20Distance%203.svg)
### 180 miles (290 km) at 180 mph (290 kph)
![Dock icon](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/60356ba44c3d89176b39a7b1_dock.svg)
### Leveraging existing dock infrastructure
Thank you! Your submission has been received!

## Our Launch Customers
We've sold over 600 seagliders with a $9B order backlog spanning global aviation and ferry customers.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/664e7238f96eac4c2808b03e_updated_map.svg)[![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/63485553ec23ca969c4f52ea_frs-logo.svg)](http://regentcraft.com/<https:/www.frs.world>)[![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/61254872151229816b6fe814_Brittany-White.svg)](http://regentcraft.com/<https:/www.brittany-ferries.co.uk/>)[![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/62b21c77b75e51a9eb9a1ebf_mokulele-logo.png)](http://regentcraft.com/<https:/mokuleleairlines.com/>)[![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/620dd473790a36983bfa1e2d_213-2135075_mesa-logo-mesa-air-group-logo.png)](http://regentcraft.com/<https:/www.mesa-air.com/>)[![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/61d62c7af683d25fdb1a2dc5_logo-southern.png)](http://regentcraft.com/<https:/iflysouthern.com>)[![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/612548723aa55662fc165996_flythewhale-white.png)](http://regentcraft.com/<https:/www.flythewhale.com/>)[![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/6125487230740c506c29ff94_splitexpress-white.png)](http://regentcraft.com/<https:/splitexpress.com/en>)[![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/62cdf3b0dfb27b9919704936_OceanFlyer%20Logo%20-%20White%20w%20white%20icon.png)](http://regentcraft.com/<https:/www.oceanflyer.co.nz/>)[![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/651491892a337fd4683bf070_ume-logo.svg)](http://regentcraft.com/<https:/www.oceanflyer.co.nz/>)
[![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/61254872151229816b6fe814_Brittany-White.svg)](http://regentcraft.com/<https:/www.brittany-ferries.co.uk/>)[![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/612548727876b578cedb4ae2_goombay-white.png)](http://regentcraft.com/<https:/goombayair.com/>)[![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/612548723aa55662fc165996_flythewhale-white.png)](http://regentcraft.com/<https:/www.flythewhale.com/>)[![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/6125487230740c506c29ff94_splitexpress-white.png)](http://regentcraft.com/<https:/splitexpress.com/en>)
[![Brittany Ferries](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/60f5c44b47dc624684cfdb07_brittany-ferries.svg)](http://regentcraft.com/<https:/www.brittany-ferries.co.uk/>)[![Goombay Air](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/60f5c446b819753f179b2cdd_goombay.png)](http://regentcraft.com/<https:/goombayair.com/>)[![Fly The Whale](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/60f5c44651a8f756dbd187be_flythewhale.png)](http://regentcraft.com/<https:/www.flythewhale.com/>)[![Splitexpress.com](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/60f5c446e95fc12831f6ad99_splitexpress.png)](http://regentcraft.com/<https:/splitexpress.com/en>)
![FRS](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/63cad8926143cd47ff18926e_frs-seaglider-updated.png)[FRS](http://regentcraft.com/<https:/www.frs.world>)
FRS, based in the North of Germany, is a successful maritime venture that has taken the initiative to develop new business activities beyond home waters.
![Mokulele Airlines](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/62b21b75f8d35d4933a655a9_mokulele-livery.png)[Mokulele Airlines](http://regentcraft.com/<https:/mokuleleairlines.com/>)
Founded in Hawaii in 1994 and based in Kailua-Kona, Mokulele Airlines is a Southern Airways company, one of America’s largest commuter airlines.
![Ocean Flyer](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/6266e991b00e545c16a12147_ocean-flyer-livery.png)[Ocean Flyer](http://regentcraft.com/<https:/www.oceanflyer.co.nz/>)
Committed to connecting communities across the motu, tackling climate change, and building a more resilient and affordable transport network for everyone in New Zealand.
![Mesa Airlines](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/620dd2fa537959e212b405df_Mesa%20Airlines%20Livery.png)[Mesa Airlines](http://regentcraft.com/<https:/www.mesa-air.com/>)
One of America’s largest regional airlines with 15 million passengers carried annually on their 140 aircraft fleet
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/61f040519a2e282492963332_b44c-2.png)[Southern Airways Express](http://regentcraft.com/<https:/iflysouthern.com>)
Leading commuter airline serving New England, Florida/Caribbean, and Hawaii
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/60550e312900a55f4491b633_brittany.png)[Brittany Ferries](http://regentcraft.com/<https:/www.brittany-ferries.co.uk/>)
Largest ferry operator in English Channel
![Fly The Whale](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/605527711460d1952208ebbb_fly-the-whale.png)[Fly The Whale](http://regentcraft.com/<https:/www.flythewhale.com/>)
Land and Sea based Charter company specializing in transfers from Manhattan and throughout the Caribbean.
![Split Express](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/6053793afa118f73ea0ed2bc_Split-Express.png)[SplitExpress.com](http://regentcraft.com/<https:/splitexpress.com/en>)
Croatian fast ferry operator servicing Split to the Croatian islands
## A new approach for regional Travel
### Lower Costs
Electric maritime transportation enables drastic decreases in fuel costs, maintenance, and taxes.
### Increased Speed
No airport security and 180mph cruise speed enable faster door-to-door times.
### Zero Emissions
Seaglider’s 100% electric propulsion system enables zero-emission, high-speed transportation.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/6750eb7b789ffcc50712028d_REGENT_Viceroy_Top.avif)
## We are the Future of Travel
Our team of experienced aerospace and naval engineers are pioneering safe, high-speed, zero-emission, regional transportation.
[Meet the Team](http://regentcraft.com/</company>)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/62ab9bc5c21cdb91d5b6e1ca_interior-lux.webp)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/6750eb7a402fe2aa8b5c7004_REGENT_Viceroy_InFlight.avif)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/62ab9bc5c865d069feff5cb0_interior-standard.webp)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/602ad05d28b6c66eb7baa871/62ab992c56ecad364a2ca709_REGENT-news.webp)

generated_description:
**Company Overview: REGENT**

**Founded:** 2020  
**Location:** North Kingstown, RI  
**Team Size:** 40 employees  
**Founders:** Billy Thalheimer and Mike Klinker (both MIT-trained ex-Boeing engineers)  
**Funding:** $50M from investors including Thiel Capital, Founders Fund, Y Combinator, and backing from airlines like Japan Airlines and Hawaiian Airlines.  
**Provisional Orders:** $8B in orders from airlines and ferry companies, with a potential market exceeding $25B.  
**Batch:** Y Combinator Batch W21

---

**Mission:**
REGENT is set on revolutionizing regional transportation with all-electric seagliders, aiming for fast, reliable, and affordable access to coastal routes. 

**Product: Seaglider**
Their flagship product, the seaglider, is an all-electric, hydrofoiling vehicle designed to operate close to the water's surface. This allows it to fly twice as far as traditional electric aircraft, while benefiting from maritime regulations that significantly cut down the costs of market entry. The seaglider can cruise at speeds of 180 mph (290 kph) over distances of up to 180 miles (290 km).

**Development Progress:**
REGENT has de-risked its technology through a ¼-scale flying demonstration vehicle and a full-scale wing test. A full-scale prototype that carries human passengers is anticipated to take flight in 2024. By mid-decade, commercial seaglider operations are expected to begin, initially featuring a 12-seat configuration.

---

**Why It Matters:**
This innovative approach addresses critical pain points in regional travel—cost, speed, and emissions. The electric powertrain allows for lower operating costs and zero emissions. Plus, with no airport security hassles and swift travel speeds, the seaglider promises faster door-to-door times compared to traditional air and ferry travel.

With a strong footing in both the aerospace and maritime sectors, REGENT is positioned to redefine how we think about regional transport over the coming years.

**Current Engagements:**
The team is actively developing and testing their technology while engaging with major airlines and ferry operators to secure partnerships for future commercial services.

For more details on REGENT and its vision for the future of travel, check their website: [REGENT](http://regentcraft.com).
